articles.title: Finance Minister announces 5 university townships near major industrial logistic hubs in Union Budget
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman also announced the setting up of one girls' hostel in every district of the country

articles.title: Tether retreats from $20 billon funding ambitions after investor pushback: Report
articles.summary: Tether's advisers have floated raising ‌as little ‌as $5 billion after facing investor reluctance, the report said, citing people familiar with the ‌matter, following talks of a $15 billion to $20 billion fundraise last year.

articles.title: Stepping in for ‘Dada’, Sunetra Pawar becomes Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister
articles.summary: NCP (AP) has unanimously chosen Sunetra Pawar as its legislative leader, paving the way for her swearing-in as deputy CM. Sharad Pawar said he was neither consulted nor informed about the decision.

articles.title: Mix of hope and fear settles over Venezuela a month after U.S.-imposed government change
articles.summary: As the initial shock of the U.S. raid and capture of then-President Nicolás Maduro gives way to a mix of uncertainty, hope and disappointment, a pervasive fear of another attack or more government repression continues to hang over Venezuelans.

articles.title: Partners earn on par with IT freshers, top performers make over Rs 51,000 a month: Urban Company
articles.summary: Urban Company said its service partners earned higher average monthly incomes this year compared to last, despite growing unrest in the gig economy. The company highlighted steady demand, insurance cover, and pension access as signs of improved work conditions. The data contrasts with recent strikes demanding better pay and worker recognition.

articles.title: Taiwan's MediaTek flags supply chain crunch from AI, says will adjust prices
articles.summary: Taiwanese tech companies like MediaTek and TSMC, the world's largest contract chipmaker, have reported surging business thanks to the AI boom.

articles.title: Trade deal with US aligns with India's manufacturing ambitions, report shows
articles.summary: A new India-US trade deal is set to boost India's manufacturing and exports. This agreement helps India diversify its trade and climb global value chains. For the US, India offers a large market and manufacturing options. The deal is expected to improve India's growth and financial stability. Export-focused sectors will benefit from better market access and certainty.

articles.title: India services activity ticks up in January, PMI shows
articles.summary: India's services sector showed strong recovery in January. New business surged, reaching its fastest pace since November. This growth was fueled by enhanced online presence and marketing efforts. International demand also contributed significantly. However, job creation remained nearly unchanged. Input costs increased, leading to higher service charges. Business confidence for the future is on the rise.

articles.title: Gold and silver get cheaper to import as government cuts base prices
articles.summary: Gold and silver import prices have been reduced by India's government. This action lowers the customs duty on these precious metals. The move comes as global prices for gold and silver are near record highs. India is a major consumer of gold and the largest market for silver. The government typically revises these prices every two weeks.

articles.title: Gold, silver or stocks? How Mukesh Ambani believes average Indian saver can compound wealth
articles.summary: Mukesh Ambani urged Indians to shift savings from gold and silver into capital markets, arguing that precious metals, though safe, do not create wealth in a fast-growing economy. Speaking at a JioBlackRock event, he said productive investments offer compounding returns, unlike bullion imports that sit idle outside the formal financial system.

articles.title: Carlsberg shares rise on profit beats forecasts; co mulls Indian IPO
articles.summary: Carlsberg reported a 5% rise in full-year operating profit, exceeding forecasts, and is considering an initial public offering for its Indian operations. The brewer also projected 2-6% profit growth for the current year, despite a challenging consumer environment. The potential Indian IPO could significantly reduce the company's debt.

articles.title: Next 20-25 years will be India's era: Blackrock CEO on why the world's biggest asset manager is betting big on Indian investors
articles.summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said the next 20–25 years will be the “era of India,” driven by rising domestic investment and rapid technological adoption. Speaking with Mukesh Ambani at a JioBlackRock event, he highlighted deeper household participation in markets and India’s growing role as a core pillar of BlackRock’s long-term strategy.

articles.title: IT stocks crash: JPMorgan analysts decode the logical and illogical reaction
articles.summary: JPMorgan says the recent global IT selloff amid AI disruption fears has veered from rational concern to outright panic. Analyst Mark Murphy noted that markets are “overwhelmingly” focused on AI headlines, ignoring enterprise software resilience. The IGV tech-software ETF fell about 5%, while stocks once considered insulated—Cloudflare, Datadog, Snowflake—plunged 9-11%, showing broad market impact across mega- and small-caps.

articles.title: 9 stocks with rising EPS over four quarters. Do you own any?
articles.summary: Nine companies from the Nifty500 universe have posted consistent quarter-on-quarter growth in earnings per share up to the December 2025 quarter, indicating improving profitability and operational efficiency. Stocks such as IIFL Finance, Shriram Finance, Craftsman Automation and Solar Industries India stood out in the StockEdge profitability scan.

articles.title: Tata Motors PV Q3 Preview: JLR hit to weigh on profits; revenue may slip up to 9% despite festive, GST tailwinds
articles.summary: Tata Motors PV Q3FY26 may show resilient India passenger vehicle demand but weak consolidated results as Jaguar Land Rover faces production disruption and margin stress after a cyber-attack, with most brokerages forecasting revenue decline and losses despite steady domestic volumes.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics: GMP hints at strong listing expectations. 10 things to know about India's first AI IPO
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics is set to launch India’s first pure-play AI IPO next week, aiming to raise Rs 2,834 crore amid rising global investor interest in AI-driven businesses. The issue is drawing strong grey market interest with a 21% premium, supported by the company’s global client base and improving financials, though valuation concerns remain.

articles.title: Commodity Radar: Aluminium prices down 12% from peak, trade below key moving averages. Time to buy, says Religare analyst
articles.summary: Aluminium prices rose on the MCX, supported by gains in Asian markets and limited global supply after China capped output. Analysts say the metal has corrected from recent highs but remains in an upward trend, with strong support near Rs 305–310 and potential upside toward Rs 335–340 in the coming weeks.

articles.title: AI is the pin popping SaaS inflated balloon: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu on Anthropic shock
articles.summary: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu has warned that AI is bursting the “inflated” SaaS bubble, as automation threatens core coding and professional tasks. He said the SaaS sector was already “ripe for consolidation,” citing a business model overly reliant on sales and marketing over product development. Years of venture capital and market hype, he added, have sustained an unsustainable system.

articles.title: Hero MotoCorp Q3 preview: Festive demand, price hikes may lift PAT 17% YoY
articles.summary: Pricing and product mix are expected to offer incremental support. HSBC notes that discounts were flat sequentially, while the company took a price hike of about 50 basis points during the quarter. Kotak expects average selling prices to rise 2–2.5% YoY, helped by a richer mix, including a higher share of exports and scooters.

articles.title: Nintendo shares slide 10% as momentum fears grow
articles.summary: The Kyoto-based gaming company on Tuesday reported robust sales for the Switch 2 during the year-end shopping season, though ‌the ‌system is viewed as lacking high-profile game titles to drive demand.

articles.title: ‘SaaSpocalypse’: What is Anthropic’s newest AI tool and what are the consequences for global tech companies?
articles.summary: Global software and IT stocks suffered a sharp selloff after Anthropic unveiled new AI tools capable of automating legal, sales, marketing and data analysis tasks. Fears that AI may replace—rather than support—software firms triggered what analysts call a “SaaSpocalypse,” wiping out billions in market value across the US, Europe and India.

articles.title: Wall Street investor Jim Rogers’ India lesson: Always own some gold and silver
articles.summary: Veteran investor Jim Rogers said precious metals remain a core part of a long-term portfolio despite recent rallies and volatility, noting he is neither buying nor selling gold and silver at current levels as he focuses on long-term investing over short-term price moves.

articles.title: Gokaldas Exports shares surge over 40% in two days after India-US trade deal
articles.summary: Gokaldas Exports shares have surged over 40% in two sessions after India and the US announced a landmark trade deal cutting tariffs to 18%. With the US contributing nearly 70% of its revenue, the company stands to benefit significantly. The stock also shows strong technical momentum and rising institutional ownership.

articles.title: India-US trade deal boosts economic outlook: GDP growth could hit 7%: Rahul Bajoria
articles.summary: India's economy is set for a major boost. A new trade deal with the United States will lower tariffs significantly. This makes India more competitive in Southeast Asia. Sectors like textiles and manufacturing will benefit. The Indian rupee is expected to strengthen. This agreement removes economic uncertainty and encourages investment. India's integration into global supply chains will accelerate.

articles.title: Anthropic's new AI tools deepen selloff in data analytics and software stocks, investors say
articles.summary: Toronto-based Thomson Reuters, which owns the Westlaw legal database, slumped by nearly 18%. It is on track for its ‌biggest daily loss on record and lowest close since J

articles.title: Silver jumps nearly Rs 11,000, nears Rs 3 lakh; gold up 3%. Is it too late to buy?
articles.summary: Gold and silver futures extended gains for a second session, driven by geopolitical tensions after the US shot down an Iranian drone, along with bargain buying and a softer dollar. MCX silver jumped 4% and gold rose 3%, while global prices surged to multi-year highs. Analysts expect continued volatility amid dollar moves and geopolitical risks.

articles.title: Vinay Rajani stays bullish on market, recommends 2 picks
articles.summary: Indian stock markets saw a significant rally of nearly 1,800 points over Monday and Tuesday. This surge was driven by positive sentiment following the India-US trade deal. Analysts highlight strong technical recovery signals and a bullish outlook. The Nifty index is nearing its all-time high, while the Bank Nifty has achieved a new record.

articles.title: HAL shares tumble 8% after L&T, Bharat Forge get shortlisted to develop fighter jets
articles.summary: Shares of Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd dropped significantly after it was not shortlisted for the Advanced Multirole Combat Aircraft programme. Larsen Toubro, Bharat Forge, and Tata Advanced Systems were selected. The winner will partner with Aeronautical Development Agency to build prototypes. This fifth-generation fighter jet is expected to be a key part of India's air combat capability from the mid-2030s.

articles.title: Reeling in bear market, should investors buy smallcap stocks after India-US trade deal?
articles.summary: India's smallcap stocks, after a sharp correction, are seeing a potential turning point following the India-US trade deal. While export-oriented companies may benefit from reduced tariffs, analysts advise a selective, bottom-up approach, focusing on fundamentals rather than broad momentum.

articles.title: US startup sets eyes on real-world AI applications in India
articles.summary: The California-based, Nasdaq-listed startup, which develops programmable AI processors and software for devices and data centres, does a significant portion of its research and development in Telangana. Half of its nearly 300 employees are based in India.

articles.title: Sam Altman appoints Dylan Scandrett as OpenAI’s Head of Preparedness amid push toward more powerful models
articles.summary: In a post on X, Altman said he was excited to welcome Scandrett, noting that “things are about to move quite fast” as OpenAI works with “extremely powerful models”. Altman added that such progress would require “commensurate safeguards” to ensure the company continues to deliver benefits responsibly.

articles.title: School assembly news headlines Feb 4: Top national, international, sports, business update and thought of the day
articles.summary: India and the US finalized a significant trade deal, boosting the rupee and leading to discussions on oil procurement and tariff adjustments. Meanwhile, national headlines include political developments, a tragic incident involving a Bengaluru CEO, and aviation safety concerns. Internationally, Russia's assault on Ukraine continues, and Pakistan faces challenges with defense deals and internal security.

articles.title: India bonds jump on US deal boost; profit-taking caps rise before RBI meet
articles.summary: Indian government bonds rallied early Tuesday following a U.S.-India trade deal, sparking hopes of increased foreign inflows due to a stronger rupee. However, profit-taking limited major moves as investors await the central bank's monetary policy decision. The benchmark 10-year bond yield eased after being pressured by high borrowing projections.

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Tuesday
articles.summary: Markets rebounded after volatility triggered by the STT hike and higher borrowing plans, aided by policy continuity and falling crude prices. Analysts warn sentiment remains cautious below the 200-day average, advising selling rallies despite medium-term confidence amid global tensions ongoing.

articles.title: How international students can work in Australia after they graduate
articles.summary: International students in Australia can pursue careers with the Temporary Graduate visa. This visa allows graduates to work and gain experience after completing their studies. It offers a bridge between student life and professional opportunities. Various streams cater to different qualifications. Graduates can explore long-term visa options and build valuable local experience.

articles.title: Don’t try to time the market in this VUCA world
articles.summary: The US-led democratic Western world played a key role in the post-Second World War growth and development. This leadership role is now under threat thanks to the unconventional, uncertain, and hugely disruptive policies and actions of President Trump.

articles.title: Sam Altman 'excited' to get Elon Musk under oath: What's Tesla CEO's lawsuit against OpenAI, Microsoft
articles.summary: Sam Altman teased Elon Musk over his lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft, which seeks up to 134 billion dollars. The trial starts in April in Oakland, California.

articles.title: Google warns 40% of Android phones vulnerable to new malware attacks
articles.summary: Only 7.5% of phones were running the most recent operating system, Android 16, when the data was collected in December.

articles.title: Full emergency declared at Kolkata airport after Turkish Airlines jet reports engine fire
articles.summary: A Turkish Airlines Airbus A330 diverted to Kolkata after reporting a mid-air right engine fire. A full emergency was declared; the aircraft continued safely on one engine.

articles.title: This Silicon Valley veteran is 'disoriented' with rise of AI; others say humans still valuable
articles.summary: Aditya Agarwal, Sam Altman, Francois Chollet, and Jensen Huang reflect on AI's impact, as coding shifts from manual craft to AI-driven problem-solving and validation in tech industry.

articles.title: Over 2.5 crore Aadhaar numbers of deceased persons deactivated to curb identity fraud
articles.summary: UIDAI says clean-up drive aims to protect Aadhaar integrity and ensure leak-proof delivery of benefits.

articles.title: Mahindra Lifespace lines up ₹8,000 crore launches to power FY27 pre-sales
articles.summary: Amit Kumar Sinha said Mahindra Lifespace expects to surpass last year’s bookings, supported by new project launches and phase launches of existing projects. He said real estate demand shows moderation in some segments, but overall inventory levels remain stable, with stronger demand shifting toward branded developers.

articles.title: Akasa Air’s 33rd Boeing 737 MAX arrives in Bengaluru, flown by all-women crew
articles.summary: Akasa Air inducts its 33rd Boeing 737 MAX aircraft at Bengaluru airport, flown by an all-women pilot crew, marking another step in fleet expansion.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics targets 25–30% revenue growth on rising enterprise AI demand
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics said enterprise AI adoption will drive future revenue growth as companies start using AI for decision-making.

articles.title: Xi Jinping, Vladimir Putin hold video talks amid evolving global dynamics
articles.summary: The virtual meeting came in the middle of a series of meetings between Xi and Western leaders who have sought to boost ties with China despite differences over Russia's war in Ukraine.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu BJP leader Annamalai steps down from party position, citing father's health condition
articles.summary: K Annamalai steps down as election in-charge for six Tamil Nadu constituencies citing his father's health. Killiyoor Congress MLA Rajesh Kumar mocks his decision, linking it to election fears.

articles.title: Ozempic maker Novo Nordisk's shares plunge 18% on bleak 2026 forecast
articles.summary: Novo Nordisk shares plunged 18% after pre-releasing a weak 2026 outlook, citing US pricing pressure on Wegovy. CEO Mike Doustdar warned of near-term headwinds despite pill launch success.

articles.title: Market extends Tuesday’s gains, Nifty ends above 25,750 as IT slides, broader markets outperform
articles.summary: Markets extended Tuesday’s gains to end at a three-week high, with the Nifty closing above 25,750 and the Sensex at 83,818, supported by Reliance Industries, private banks and strength in broader markets. The Nifty IT index slid 5% on worries around the Anthropic AI tool, while HAL fell 6% on reports of losing out on a jet fighter order.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: Disney just announced its new CEO. Here's what it means for investors
articles.summary: The average analyst has a buy rating and a price target suggesting shares can rally more than 27%, according to LSEG.

articles.title: India’s electric two-wheeler market growth forecast at 16-18% as supply chains stabilise: CRISIL
articles.summary: India’s electric two-wheeler growth to rebound to 16-18 percent next fiscal, driven by rare-earth magnet supply from China and legacy players like CRISIL Ratings leading market share gains.

articles.title: BHEL shares gain after bagging order worth up to ₹1,500 crore from Hindalco
articles.summary: As per the contract terms, Unit 1 is scheduled to be commissioned within 35 months, while Unit 2 will be commissioned within 37 months from the effective date of the contract, which will be the date of issuance of the LoI.

articles.title: Ananya Birla launches Birla Studios, plans multi-language film slate for India, overseas
articles.summary: Ananya Birla has launched Birla Studios, a film banner developing multi-language projects for Indian and global audiences, focused on culturally rooted stories with commercial scale.

articles.title: PepsiCo to cut prices of Lay's, Doritos as consumers push back
articles.summary: Rival Coca-Cola and consumer giant Procter & Gamble have also lowered prices to safeguard market share amid still-elevated inflation and delayed food stamp benefits for lower-income families.

articles.title: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Enrique Lores
articles.summary: PayPal replaces CEO Alex Chriss with Enrique Lores, citing slow change. Lores, former HP Inc. CEO, takes over March 1. Shares fell 16 percent after missing Q4 profit and revenue expectations.

articles.title: Anthropic unveils $350 billion valuation tender offer, eyes $20 billion funding
articles.summary: Anthropic plans a tender offer letting employees sell shares at a $350 billion valuation, alongside a funding round over $20 billion, boosting liquidity in the competitive AI sector.

articles.title: Why this $25 billion fund is not giving up on IT stocks yet
articles.summary: A sharp global tech selloff has rattled Indian IT stocks, but DSP Mutual Fund is not rushing for the exit. The $25 billion fund says AI fears need deeper earnings analysis, as integration work could still drive the next spending cycle.

articles.title: Foreign investors may return to India, but not everyone is convinced it matters
articles.summary: Foreign investors have pulled out roughly $35–40 billion from Indian equities over the past 15–18 months, yet the market has largely held its ground. With the India–US trade deal removing a key uncertainty, the big question is whether this could finally trigger a reversal in flows.

articles.title: Crypto market loses nearly $500 billion in a week as Bitcoin slumps to 15-month low
articles.summary: Nearly $500 billion was wiped from crypto as Bitcoin fell to $72,877, its lowest since Trump’s re-election, raising doubts about its “digital gold” status.

articles.title: Tech sell-off sparks AI worries over Indian IT services: Arvind Sanger, Moshe Katri debate outlook
articles.summary: As AI adoption picks up speed, Indian IT services companies could be heading into a phase that changes both growth and valuations. Arvind Sanger and Moshe Katri say the next few years will show whether the sector benefits from helping companies integrate AI or faces deeper disruption to its traditional services model.

articles.title: Hindustan Aeronautics shares fall over 6% on Wednesday; Here's why

articles.summary: Three minor sisters aged 16, 14 and 12 died after falling from a ninth-floor flat in Ghaziabad, as police probe possible links to mobile phone use, a Korean online game and a note found at home.

articles.title: Delhi horror: Over 500 women among 807 missing cases in first 15 days of 2026
articles.summary: On an average, 54 people reportedly went missing in the national capital on a daily basis, between January 1 and January 15.

articles.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. will export 35,000 Scorpio Pik Up units to Agrinas Pangan Nusantara for Indonesia's KDKMP Project, its largest order, boosting rural logistics and food security.

articles.title: Nazara Technologies says core business improving, more acquisitions on radar
articles.summary: Nitish Mittersain, Joint MD and CEO of Nazara Technologies said that the company saw about 10% organic revenue growth and more than 25% profitability growth, excluding acquisitions and deconsolidation. The company invested about ₹500 crore in acquisitions last year and has about ₹700 crore in net cash. The company may raise capital if required, but no decision has been finalised.

Anthropic's new AI tools, and the rapid evolution of AI capabilities is forcing investors to reconsider long-standing assumptions about the defensibility of data, research and software subscription businesses.

articles.summary: This powerful agentic tool automates multi-step tasks such as research travel costs, booking appointments, and managing subscriptions directly for you.
